title: Dawn Song by the Lake
description: Woke up to birdsong. Near the reeds, I spotted a robin. It sat in one place for a long time, singing loudly. I watched it quietly for almost an hour.

title: Unexpected Find in the Park
description: While walking through the park, I stumbled upon a small pale blue egg—likely a thrush's. There was no visible nest nearby. I made sure not to disturb it.

title: Nest in the Old Spruce
location: Spruce Forest by the Dacha, Moscow Region
description: Deep in the spruce woods I found a nest with three speckled beige eggs. Based on the size and position, I think it belongs to a tit. I’ll keep observing from a distance.

title: First Starling of the Season
description: A starling has arrived — early this year. It was singing from a power line on the field’s edge. What a joy to see the first returning bird of spring.

title: Nest Under the Barn Roof
description: A pair of swallows are building a nest under the barn roof. They're flying back and forth with straw and mud. I’ve logged the location and will follow their progress.

title: Eggs on the Riverbank
description: I found four eggs right out in the open — no nest. Most likely gulls or sandpipers. They were well-camouflaged among the pebbles. I took a photo and carefully stepped away.
